curam.util.resources
Class SMTPConnection

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.resources.SMTPConnection

public class SMTPConnection
extends java.lang.Object

Provides interfaces for communicating with an SMTP (simple mail transfer protocol) mail server.

Constructor Detail

SMTPConnection

public SMTPConnection(java.lang.String clientName,
                      java.lang.String serverName,
                      int port)
Construct a connection. This does not establish a connection to the SMTP mail server, this is not done until sendMessage is invoked.

Parameters:
clientName - This is an optional field indicating the machine name of the client on which the call is invoked.
serverName - The name of the server machine on which the SMTP Server is running. If this is left blank the value of the environment variable mail.smtp.host is used. If this environment variable is not set a default of local host is used.
port - The port number on which the SMTP Server is listening.

SMTPConnection

public SMTPConnection(java.lang.String clientName,
                      java.lang.String serverName)
Constructs a connection with the port defaulted to 25. This does not establish a connection to the SMTP mail server, this is not done until sendMessage is invoked.

Parameters:
clientName - This is an optional field indicating the machine name of the client on which the call is invoked.
serverName - The name of the server machine on which the SMTP Server is running. If this is left blank the value of the environment variable mail.smtp.host is used. If this environment variable is not set a default of local host is used.
Method Detail

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(java.lang.String from,
                        java.lang.String subject,
                        java.lang.String to,
                        java.lang.String cc,
                        java.lang.String bcc,
                        java.lang.String message)
                 throws AppException
Sends an e-mail with a message body encoded using the default plain text encoding.

Parameters:
from - The e-mail address of the individual sending the message. This address follows the standards in JavaMail and as such those in RFC-822.
subject - The text that will make up the subject line of the address.
to - The e-mail addresses of the individuals to whom the message should be addressed. Multiple addresses can be separated by a , or ; (optionally surrounded by <>). The individual addresses follow the standards in JavaMail and as such those in RFC-822.
cc - The e-mail addresses of the individuals to whom the message should be carbon copied. Multiple addresses can be separated by a , or ; (optionally surrounded by <>). The individual addresses follow the standards in JavaMail and as such those in RFC-822.
bcc - The e-mail addresses of the individuals to whom the message should be blind carbon copied. Multiple addresses can be separated by a , or ; (optionally surrounded by <>). The individual addresses follow the standards in JavaMail and as such those in RFC-822.
message - The text that should make up the message body
Throws:
AppException - ID_RECIP_EMAIL_ERROR - if some of the specified addresses were not valid. The problematic addresses are listed in the exception's text.
AppException - ID_EMPTY_RECIP_EMAIL_ERROR - if the specified to address is empty
AppException - ID_EMPTY_SENDER_EMAIL_ERROR - if the specified from address is empty
AppException - ID_UNKNOWN_EMAIL_ERROR - if an unknown error occurred when sending the e-mail. The underlying exception is chained to this exception.
AppException - ID_SERVER_EMAIL_ERROR - if the mail server that was specified cannot be found.

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(java.lang.String from,
                        java.lang.String subject,
                        java.lang.String to,
                        java.lang.String cc,
                        java.lang.String bcc,
                        java.lang.String message,
                        java.lang.String attachmentFileName,
                        java.lang.String attachmentText)
                 throws AppException
Sends an e-mail with a plain text body with a plain text attachment type.

Parameters:
from - The e-mail address of the individual sending the message. This address follows the standards in JavaMail and as such those in RFC-822.
subject - The text that will make up the subject line of the address.
to - The e-mail addresses of the individuals to whom the message should be addressed. Multiple addresses can be separated by a , or ; (optionally surrounded by <>). The individual addresses follow the standards in JavaMail and as such those in RFC-822.
cc - The e-mail addresses of the individuals to whom the message should be carbon copied. Multiple addresses can be separated by a , or ; (optionally surrounded by <>). The individual addresses follow the standards in JavaMail and as such those in RFC-822.
bcc - The e-mail addresses of the individuals to whom the message should be blind carbon copied. Multiple addresses can be separated by a , or ; (optionally surrounded by <>). The individual addresses follow the standards in JavaMail and as such those in RFC-822.
message - The text that should make up the message body
attachmentFileName - The name which will be presented as the attachment file name.
attachmentText - The text which will be delivered inside the attachment.
Throws:
AppException - ID_RECIP_EMAIL_ERROR - if some of the specified addresses were not valid. The problematic addresses are listed in the exception's text.
AppException - ID_EMPTY_RECIP_EMAIL_ERROR - if the specified to address is empty
AppException - ID_EMPTY_SENDER_EMAIL_ERROR - if the specified from address is empty
AppException - ID_UNKNOWN_EMAIL_ERROR - if an unknown error occurred when sending the e-mail. The underlying exception is chained to this exception.
AppException - ID_SERVER_EMAIL_ERROR - if the mail server that was specified cannot be found.

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(java.lang.String from,
                        java.lang.String subject,
                        java.lang.String to,
                        java.lang.String cc,
                        java.lang.String bcc,
                        java.lang.String message,
                        java.lang.String attachmentMimeType,
                        java.lang.String attachmentFileName,
                        java.lang.Object attachment)
                 throws AppException
Sends an e-mail whose message body is encoded as plain text and includes an attached file that is encoded with the specified MIME type. The MIME type must be supported by the javax.mail framework, and it must be compatible with the attachment Object type. In the case where the attachment is of type curam.util.type.Blob the MIME type will default to "application/octet-stream".

Parameters:
from - The e-mail address of the individual sending the message. This address follows the standards in JavaMail and as such those in RFC-822.
subject - The text that will make up the subject line of the address.
to - The e-mail addresses of the individuals to whom the message should be addressed. Multiple addresses can be separated by a , or ; (optionally surrounded by <>). The individual addresses follow the standards in JavaMail and as such those in RFC-822.
cc - The e-mail addresses of the individuals to whom the message should be carbon copied. Multiple addresses can be separated by a , or ; (optionally surrounded by <>). The individual addresses follow the standards in JavaMail and as such those in RFC-822.
bcc - The e-mail addresses of the individuals to whom the message should be blind carbon copied. Multiple addresses can be separated by a , or ; (optionally surrounded by <>). The individual addresses follow the standards in JavaMail and as such those in RFC-822.
message - The body of the mail itself, containing the message which is to be sent to the associated people.
attachmentMimeType - The MIME type which is associated with the file to be attached to the message. The MIME type should be of one which is supported by the javax.mail framework. In the case where the attachment is of type curam.util.type.Blob the MIME type will default to "application/octet-stream".
attachmentFileName - The name which will be presented as the attachment file name.
attachment - The data to be attached to the email. This must be a valid Object type that is supported by the specified MIME type. For example, a binary data attachment of type curam.util.type.Blob should have a MIME type of "application/octet-stream".
Throws:
AppException - ID_RECIP_EMAIL_ERROR - if some of the specified addresses were not valid. The problematic addresses are listed in the exception's text.
AppException - ID_EMPTY_RECIP_EMAIL_ERROR - if the specified to address is empty
AppException - ID_EMPTY_SENDER_EMAIL_ERROR - if the specified from address is empty
AppException - ID_UNKNOWN_EMAIL_ERROR - if an unknown error occurred when sending the e-mail. The underlying exception is chained to this exception.
AppException - ID_SERVER_EMAIL_ERROR - if the mail server that was specified cannot be found.
AppException - ID_EMAIL_MIME_TYPE_ERROR - if the MIME type specified is invalid or if it is not compatible with the attachment.
